ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport]Protocol servers MUST support SOAP over HTTP.
[In Transport]Protocol servers SHOULD additionally support SOAP over HTTPS for securing communication with clients.
[In Transport]Protocol messages MUST be formatted as specified either in [SOAP1.1], section 4 "SOAP Envelope" or in [SOAP1.2-1/2007], section 5 "SOAP Message Construct."
[In Transport]Protocol server faults MUST be returned using HTTP Status-Codes as specified in [RFC2616], section 10 "Status Code Definitions".
[In Transport]Protocol server faults MUST be returned using SOAP faults as specified either in [SOAP1.1], section 4.4 "SOAP Fault" or in [SOAP1.2-1/2007], section 5.4 "SOAP Fault."
[In Common Message Syntax]This section contains common definitions used by this protocol.
[In Common Message Syntax]The syntax of the definitions uses XML schema as defined in [XMLSCHEMA1/2] and [XMLSCHEMA2/2], and WSDL as defined in [WSDL].
[In Namespaces]This protocol [MS-ADMINS] specifies and references XML namespaces using the mechanisms specified in [XMLNS].

[In Namespaces]Although this document [MS-ADMINS] associates a prefix for each XML namespace that is used, the choice of any particular prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "soap" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/", which refers to "[SOAP1.1]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "tns" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "s" is used for the namespace URI " http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema", which refers to "[XMLSCHEMA1/2]" and "[XMLSCHEMA2/2]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "soap12" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap12/", which refers to "[SOAP1.2-1/2007]" and "[SOAP1.2-2/2007]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "(none)" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "wsdl" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/", which refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "mime" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/mime/", which refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "s1" is used for the namespace URI "http://microsoft.com/wsdl/types/".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "tm" is used for the namespace URI "http://microsoft.com/wsdl/mime/textMatching/".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "http" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/http/", which refers to "[RFC2616]".
[In Namespaces]The Prefix "soapenc" is used for the namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/", which refers to "[SOAP1.2-1/2007]" and "[SOAP1.2-2/2007]".
[In Messages]This specification does not define any common WSDL message definitions.
[In Elements]This specification does not define any common XML Schema element definitions.
[In SOAPFaultDetails][The complex type SOAPFaultDetails describes] The details of a SOAP fault.

[In SOAPFaultDetails]The schema of SOAPFaultDetails is defined as: <s:schema xmlns:s="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" targetNamespace=" http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap"> <s:complexType name="SOAPFaultDetails"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="errorstring" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="errorcode" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:schema>
[In SOAPFaultDetails] errorstring: A human-readable text explaining the application-level fault.
[In SOAPFaultDetails] errorcode: The hexadecimal representation of a 4-byte result code.
[In SOAPFaultDetails]The format inside the string [errorcode] MUST be 0xAAAAAAAA.
[In Simple Types]This specification does not define any common XML Schema simple type definitions.
[In Attributes]This specification does not define any common XML Schema attribute definitions.
[In Groups]This specification does not define any common XML Schema group definitions.
[In Attribute Groups]This specification does not define any common XML schema attribute group definitions.
[In Protocol Details]The client side of this protocol [MS-ADMINS] is simply a pass-through.
[In Protocol Details][The client side of this protocol is simply a pass-through] That is, no additional timers or other state is required on the client side of this protocol [MS-ADMINS].

[In Protocol Details]Calls made by the higher-layer protocol or application are passed directly to the transport, and the results returned by the transport are passed directly back to the higher-layer protocol or application.
[In Protocol Details]Except where specified, protocol clients SHOULD interpret HTTP Status Codes returned by the protocol server as specified in [RFC2616], section 10 "Status Code Definitions."
[In Protocol Details]This protocol [MS-ADMINS] allows protocol servers to notify protocol clients of application-level faults using SOAP faults.

[In Protocol Details]This protocol [MS-ADMINS] allows protocol servers to provide additional details for SOAP faults by including a detail element as specified either in [SOAP1.1], section 4.4 "SOAP Fault" or [SOAP1.2-1/2007], section 5.4 "SOAP Fault" that conforms to the XML schema of the SOAPFaultDetails complex type specified in section 2.2.4.1.
[In Protocol Details]Except where specified, these SOAP faults are not significant for interoperability, and protocol clients can interpret them in an implementation-specific manner.
[In Protocol Details]This protocol [MS-ADMINS] allows protocol servers to perform implementation-specific authorization checks.

[In Protocol Details][This protocol MS-ADMINS allows protocol servers] to notify protocol clients of authorization faults either using HTTP status codes or SOAP faults as specified previously in this section.
[In Server Details]The following diagram describes the communication between the protocol client and the protocol server.
[Abstract Data Model]This section describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[Abstract Data Model]The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[Abstract Data Model]This document does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this document.
[Abstract Data Model]There is a list of site definitions supported by this protocol server.
[Abstract Data Model]The protocol client can customize a site to create custom templates.
[Abstract Data Model]The protocol sever maintains a mapping between a custom template and its site definition.

[Abstract Data Model]For an overview of site, site collection and site definition and protocol sever in general, see [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.2.6 Site, [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.2.5 Site Collection, and [MS-WSSTS] section 2.1.3.1 Site Definition.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules]The following table summarizes the list of WSDL operations defined in this specification: CreateSite, DeleteSite, GetLanguages, RefreshConfigCache.
[Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules]The operation "CreateSite" is used to creates a site collection.
[Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules]The operation "DeleteSite" is used to deletes the specified site collection.
[Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules]The operation "GetLanguages" is used to return information about the languages used in the protocol server deployment.
[Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules]The operation "RefreshConfigCache" does nothing and is now obsolete.
[In CreateSite]This operation[CreateSite] creates a site collection.

[In CreateSite][The schema of CreateSite operation is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="CreateSite"> <wsdl:input message="tns:CreateSiteSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:CreateSiteSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In CreateSite]The client sends a CreateSiteSoapIn request message, the server responds with a CreateSiteSoapOut response message.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]The request message[CreateSiteSoapIn message] that initiates the creation of the site collection.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]The SOAP action value of the message[CreateSiteSoapIn message] is as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/CreateSite
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]The SOAP body contains a CreateSite element.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:]The absolute URL of the site collection to be created MUST be included in the request message.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:]If the URL is missing, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:]If the URL is not valid, the server MUST return a SOAP fault. See section 3.1.4.1.2.1 for restrictions.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R1024, MS-ADMINS_R1025, MS-ADMINS_R1026, MS-ADMINS_R1027, MS-ADMINS_R1028.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSiteSoapIn]If ServerName in the URL is invalid, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If the PortNumber in the URL given an invalid value, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.

[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If the URL does not comply with either of the two formats: http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName or http://ServerName/sites/SiteCollectionName, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If the URL is empty, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If Url's length not including "http://ServerName" exceeds 128 characters, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:]If the URL already exists, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn] If the LCID is zero, the server MUST create the site with current server language.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn] If the LCID is invalid [or not installed], then the server MUST return a SOAP fault with error code 0x8102005e.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn] If the LCID is [invalid or] not installed, then the server MUST return a SOAP fault with error code 0x8102005e.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If WebTemplate is not empty, and if it is not available in the list of templates and it is not a custom template, then the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]The valid OwnerLogin MUST be included in the request message.
[In CreateSiteSoapIn]If OwnerLogin is not an existing domain user account, the server MUST return a SOAP fault with error code 0x80131600.
[In CreateSiteSoapOut]The response message in reply to the request initiated with the CreateSiteSoapIn message to create a site collection.
[In CreateSiteSoapOut]The SOAP body contains a CreateSiteResponse element.
[In CreateSite][The CreateSite element is used to] create a site collection.

[In CreateSite][The schema of CreateSite element is defined as:] <s:element name="CreateSite"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Url" type="s:string" /> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Title" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Description" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Lcid" type="s:int" /> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="WebTemplate" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="OwnerLogin" type="s:string" /> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="OwnerName" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="OwnerEmail" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="PortalUrl" type="s:string"/> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="PortalName" type="s:string"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateSite]Url: The absolute URL of the site collection.
[In CreateSite]It[Url] MUST be formatted as either http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName or http://ServerName/sites/SiteCollectionName.
[In CreateSite]If the Url contains the port number, the Url format is http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName.
[In CreateSite]If the Url does not contain the port number, the Url format is http://ServerName/sites/SiteCollectionName.
[In CreateSite]Its[Url's] maximum length, not including http://ServerName or http://ServerName:PortNumber, is 128 characters.
[In CreateSite]If it[Url] is missing or absent, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.

[In CreateSite]PortNumber in the [Url's] first format [http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName] MUST be the port number used by either the web application or the Administration Web Service on the protocol server.
[In CreateSite]PortNumber in the [Url's] first format [http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName] MUST be the port number used by the web application on the protocol server.
[In CreateSite]PortNumber in the [Url's] first format [http://ServerName:PortNumber/sites/SiteCollectionName] MUST be the port number used by or the Administration Web Service on the protocol server.
[In CreateSite]Title: The display name of the site collection.
[In CreateSite]It[Title] MUST be less than or equal to 255 characters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R3015, MS-ADMINS_R3016, MS-ADMINS_R3034.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]If the length of the Title is 254 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the Title is 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the Title exceeds 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed without exception, the exceeded characters are truncated.
[In CreateSite]If [the Title] nothing is specified, the [created]site will have a default title of "Team Site".
[In CreateSite]Description: A description of the site collection.
[In CreateSite]If [the Description] nothing is specified, the [created] site will not have a description.
[In CreateSite]A valid LCID, as specified in [MS-LCID], which specifies the language that is used in the site collection.
[In CreateSite]If it[LCID] is missing, the server MUST assign a default LCID.<1>
[In CreateSite]WebTemplate: The name of the site template to use when creating the site collection.
[In CreateSite]GetSiteTemplates in [MS-SITESS] section 3.1.4.2 can be used to get a list of site template.
[In CreateSite]If no template[WebTemplate] is specified, then no template will be applied to the site at creation time.
[In CreateSite]OwnerLogin: The user name of the site collection owner.
[In CreateSite]It[OwnerLogin] MUST be less than or equal to 255 characters.<2>
[In CreateSite]If it[OwnerLogin] is missing, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSite]If it[OwnerLogin] is empty, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In CreateSite]OwnerName: The display name of the owner.
[In CreateSite]It[OwnerName] MUST be less than or equal to 255 characters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R3023, MS-ADMINS_R3037, MS-ADMINS_R3024.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerName is 254 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerName is 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerName exceeds 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed without exception, the exceeds characters are truncated.
[In CreateSite]If it[OwnerName] is not specified, the name will be taken from the user database entry corresponding to the owner user.
[In CreateSite]OwnerEmail: The e-mail address of the owner.
[In CreateSite]It[OwnerEmail] MUST be less than or equal to 255 characters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R3025, MS-ADMINS_R3013, MS-ADMINS_R3026.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerEmail is 254 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerEmail is 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the OwnerEmail exceeds 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed without exception, the exceeded characters are truncated.
[In CreateSite]If it[OwnerEmail] is not specified, the e-mail will be taken from the user database entry corresponding to the owner user.
[In CreateSite]PortalUrl: The URL of the portal site for the site collection.
[In CreateSite]It[PortalUrl] MUST be less than or equal to 260 characters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R3027, MS-ADMINS_R3038, MS-ADMINS_R3028.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalUrl is 259 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalUrl is 260 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalUrl exceeds 260 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed without exception, the exceeds characters are truncated.
[In CreateSite]If [the PortalUrl] nothing is specified, no portal URL will be set in the database.
[In CreateSite]There is no URL validation performed on this element[PortalUrl] other than the check for its existence.
[In CreateSite]If the URL[PortalUrl] is absent or empty, no portal URL will be set in the database.
[In CreateSite]PortalName: The name of the portal site for the site collection.
[In CreateSite]It[PortalName] MUST be less than or equal to 255 characters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-ADMINS_R3029, MS-ADMINS_R3039, MS-ADMINS_R3030.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalName is 254 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalName is 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed.
[In CreateSite]If the length of the PortalName exceeds 255 characters, the CreateSite operation will succeed without exception, the exceeds characters are truncated.
[In CreateSite]If[the PortalName] nothing is specified, no portal name will be set in the database.
[In CreateSiteResponse]CreateSiteResponse [element] is returned as the response to the CreateSiteRequest message.

[In CreateSiteResponse][The schema of CreateSiteResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="CreateSiteResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="CreateSiteResult" type="s:string"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateSiteResponse]CreateSiteResult: Specifies the URL of the new site collection.
[In CreateSiteResponse]It[CreateSiteResult] MUST be returned if the CreateSite operation succeeds.
[In DeleteSite]This operation [the DeleteSite operation] deletes the specified site collection.

[In DeleteSite][The schema of DeleteSite operation is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="DeleteSite"> <wsdl:input message="tns:DeleteSiteSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:DeleteSiteSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In DeleteSite]The client sends a DeleteSiteSoapIn request message and the server responds with a DeleteSiteSoapOut response message.
[In DeleteSite]The [DeleteSiteSoapIn] request message MUST contain the absolute URL of the site collection to be deleted.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn]The message requesting deletion of the site collection.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn]The SOAP action value of the message[DeleteSiteSoapIn message] is as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/DeleteSite
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn]The SOAP body contains a DeleteSite element.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:]The absolute URL of the site collection to be deleted MUST be included in the request message.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:] If the URL is missing, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:] If the URL is not valid, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In DeleteSiteSoapIn][The request message is governed by the following rules:] If the URL does not exist, the server MUST return a SOAP fault.
[In DeleteSiteSoapOut][DeleteSiteSoapOut message is] The response message reply to the request initiated with the DeleteSiteSoapIn message to delete the site collection.
[In DeleteSiteSoapOut]The SOAP body contains a DeleteSiteResponse element.
[In DeleteSite][The DeleteSite element is used to] Deletes the specified site collection.

[In DeleteSite][The schema of DeleteSite element is defined as:] <s:element name="DeleteSite"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="Url" type="s:string"> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteSite]Url: The absolute URL of the site collection to be deleted.
[In DeleteSiteResponse]DeleteSiteResponse [element] is returned as the response to the DeleteSiteRequest.
[In DeleteSiteResponse][The schema of DeleteSiteResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="DeleteSiteResponse"> <s:complexType/></s:element>
[In GetLanguages]Returns LCID values that specify the languages used in the protocol server deployment.

[In GetLanguages][The schema of GetLanguages operation is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="GetLanguages"> <wsdl:input message="tns:GetLanguagesSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:GetLanguagesSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In GetLanguages]The client sends a GetLanguagesSoapIn request message and the server responds with a GetLanguagesSoapOut response message.
[In GetLanguagesSoapIn][The GetLanguagesSoapIn message]Provides the request message to obtain LCID values.
[In GetLanguagesSoapIn]The SOAP action value of the message[GetLanguagesSoapIn message] is as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/GetLanguages
[In GetLanguagesSoapIn]The SOAP body contains a GetLanguages element.
[In GetLanguagesSoapOut]The response message[GetLanguagesSoapOut message is] to the LCID request.
[In GetLanguagesSoapOut]The SOAP body contains a GetLanguagesResponse element.
[In GetLanguages]GetLanguages [element] returns LCID values that specify the languages used in the protocol server deployment.
[In GetLanguages][The schema of DeleteSite element is defined as:] <s:element name="GetLanguages"> <s:complexType/> </s:element>
[In GetLanguagesResponse]GetLanguagesResponse [element] is returned as the response message in reply to the GetLanguagesRequest message.

[In GetLanguagesResponse][The schema of DeleteSiteResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="GetLanguagesResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="GetLanguagesResult"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="Languages"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="LCID" type="s:int" /> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In GetLanguagesResponse]GetLanguagesResult: Provides the locale identifiers (LCIDs) of languages used in the deployment.
[In GetLanguagesResponse] Languages: Specifies the languages used in the deployment.
[In GetLanguagesResponse] LCID: Specifies the locale identifier (LCID) of a language used in the deployment.
[In RefreshConfigCache]This operation [the RefreshConfigCache operation] does nothing and is obsolete.
[In RefreshConfigCache]RefreshConfigCache SHOULD NOT<3> be used.

[In RefreshConfigCache][The schema of RefreshConfigCache operation is defined as:] <wsdl:operation name="RefreshConfigCache"> <wsdl:input message="tns:RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:RefreshConfigCacheSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In RefreshConfigCache]The client sends a RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn request message and the server responds with a RefreshConfigCacheSoapOut response message.
[In RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn]The response message reply to the request initiated with the RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn message is obsolete.
[In RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn]The SOAP action value of the message[RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn message] is as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/RefreshConfigCache
[In RefreshConfigCacheSoapIn]The SOAP body contains a RefreshConfigCache element.
[In RefreshConfigCacheSoapOut] RefreshConfigCacheSoapOut [message] does nothing and is obsolete.
[In RefreshConfigCacheSoapOut]The SOAP body contains a RefreshConfigCacheResponse element.
[In RefreshConfigCache]This element [RefreshConfigCache element] does nothing and is obsolete.

[In RefreshConfigCache][The schema of RefreshConfigCache element is defined as:] <s:element name="RefreshConfigCache"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="VirtualServerId" type="s1:guid"/> <s:element name="AdminGroupChanged" type="s:boolean"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In RefreshConfigCache]VirtualServerId: A s1:guid (as specified in section 3.1.4.4.4) type.
[In RefreshConfigCache] Represents the GUID for web application.
[In RefreshConfigCache]AdminGroupChanged: Set to "true" to specify that the administrator group has changed; otherwise, "false".
[In RefreshConfigCacheResponse]RefreshConfigCacheResponse [element] does nothing and is obsolete.
[In RefreshConfigCacheResponse][The schema of RefreshConfigCacheResponse element is defined as:] <s:element name="RefreshConfigCacheResponse"> <s:complexType/> </s:element>
[Simple Types]The following table summarizes the XML schema simple definitions that are specific to this operation:s1:guid.
[Simple Types] s1:guid: Represents a GUID.
[s1:guid] The s1:guid simple type is used to represent a GUID value.

[s1:guid] <s:simpleType name="s1:guid"> <s:restriction base="s:string"> <s:pattern value="[0-9a-fA-F]{8}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{4}-[0-9a-fA-F]{12}" /> </s:restriction> </s:simpleType>
[In Transport]Implementation does additionally support SOAP over HTTPS for securing communication with clients.(Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and above products follow this behavior.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, any statement of optional behavior in this specification that is prescribed using the terms SHOULD or SHOULD NOT implies product behavior in accordance with the SHOULD or SHOULD NOT prescription.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, the term MAY implies that the product does not follow the prescription.

[In CreateSite]Implementation does assign a default LCID based on the default server install language when it is missing. [In Appendix B: Product Behavior](<1> Section 3.1.4.1.2.1: Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateSite]<2> Section 3.1.4.1.2.1: The max length for OwnerLogin is 20 characters on Windows Server 2008 operating system with Service Pack 2 (SP2).
